bill_title: prohibit the use of political litmus tests in education.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to prohibit the use of political litmus tests in education. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That chapter 13-49 be amended with a NEW SECTION: A person seeking employment, promotion, or tenure, at an institution under the control of the Board of Regents, may not be given or otherwise subjected to a political litmus test, as a condition of becoming employed, being retained, fulfilling normal employment expectations, being promoted, or achieving tenure. For purposes of this section, the term, given or subjected to a political litmus test, means: (1) Being compelled or solicited to identify a commitment to or make a statement of personal beliefs in support of an ideology or movement that promotes: (a) The differential treatment of a person or a group, based on ethnicity or race, including any initiative or formulation of diversity, equity, and inclusion, beyond upholding the equal protection of the laws guaranteed by the Fourteenth Amendment of the United States Constitution; or any theory or practice that holds that systems or institutions upholding the equal protection of the laws guaranteed by the Fourteenth Amendment of the United States Constitution are racist, oppressive, or otherwise unjust; (b) The alleged systemic nature of racism, or the alleged multiplicity or fluidity of gender identities; or (c) Any other partisan, political, or ideological set of beliefs; and (2) Being accorded preferential consideration for opinions expressed or acts undertaken in support of: (a) A person or group, on the basis of ethnicity or race; (b) The alleged systemic nature of racism, or the alleged multiplicity or fluidity of gender identities; or (c) Any other partisan, political, or ideological set of beliefs. Section 2. That chapter 13-53 be amended with a NEW SECTION: A student seeking admission to an institution under the control of the Board of Regents, may not be given or otherwise subjected to a political litmus test, as a condition of admission.
